titles: The speech of Major John Harris at the place of execution, near St. Mary Axe, on Monday the third of September, 1660. With his prayer immediately before his death; and his confession touching his appearing on the scaffold before White-Hall, at the most horrid murder of our late gracious Soveraign Lord King Charles.
author: Harris, John, d. 1660.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Harris, John, d. 1660 --  Early works to 1800.
Execution and executioners --  England --  Early works to 1800.
